headline: Lemon Bars
description: This recipe levels up by putting lemon bars onto a shortbread base, blending two great ideas into one delightful treat.
name: Lemon Bars

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix 1 cup flour and 1/4 cup confectioners sugar in a medium bowl. Melt butter and stir into flour mixture. Press evenly into an 8x8-inch baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.

While crust bakes, make topping: Mix 1 cup white sugar, 2 tablespoons flour, and baking powder in a large bowl. Beat eggs and add to mixture, stirring well. Add lemon juice and zest; mix well. Pour over crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Cool slightly, then cut into squares while warm; dust with confectioners' sugar.

I've been cooking since I was eight and going to the Institute of Culinary Education. Lemon bars are my specialty. Here's a few other things you can do to make them better than they already are! 
1. Add pumpkin spice! 
 Trust me on this one... A dash of pumpkin spice to the crust (bottom layer) will add a ZING to it! It doesn't even make it taste pumpkiny! 
2. Freeze it. 
 Right after your top layer is finished cooking and your lemon bars are cut into squares, freeze them! Not over night, more like half and hour to an hour. Take them out and let sit for about ten minutes, and they will be perfect! 
3. Lime! 
 If you really love citrus fruits (like me) then don't be afraid to squeeze a lime over your finished lemon bars. And once the lime has set in, add the sugar!
I really hope this advice helped you and made your lemon bars the best they can be!
